can be entertained of the certainty of contriving
means to discharge it; for Bridewell
and Hanham Mill ponds are nearly level, so
are those of Newgate and Keysham; consequently
the fall is as great in a quarter of a
mile to the Avon from the Frome, as it is on
the Avon itself in a distance of 8 miles and
upwards.
A Tunnel may be made, if necessary,
from Newgate Mill pond to the Avon, that
would carry off all the water; even such a flood
as we had the 9th inst. might be got rid of,
so as to do no mischief to this part of the town.
These are matters worthy of consideration,
even if no improvement be made to the harbour,
as it will not in the smallest degree injure the
Mills; but it cannot be effected if the Avon
be damed.
